comments:
LGST101 presents law as an evolving social institution, with special emphasis on the legal regulation of business. It considers basic concepts of law and legal process, in the U.S. and other legal systems, and introduces the fundamentals of rigorous legal analysis. An in-depth examination of contract law is included. 

Students felt that “this was an interesting class,” perhaps even “one of the most interesting I have ever taken.” This course is “seminar style” with plenty of opportunity for participation. Students “learned a great deal” and found each lecture to be “stimulating.” 

According to his students, Professor Constan is a “really great professor” and “a great person.” The professor “did a good job of facilitating discussion,” as he is “really entertaining.” “His love of students” was evident, especially considering that “he took time to meet with each student individually.” A few students felt that Professor Constan embarrassed students “for getting things wrong.” Some felt that Professor Constan was more challenging than other professors. Students enjoyed “the one-on-one sessions” to meet with the professor. Students liked Professor Constan’s “interesting stories” to help explain the course’s “major ideas.” However another student felt Professor Constan was “long-winded” when explaining certain concepts. 

Some felt that the readings were “dense and confusing,” while others recommended doing the readings to “do well and enjoy lecture.” One student felt that the midterm was “hard” and did not feel that the grading was “objective.” One student would have liked a better syllabus. This review was based on the 3 student comments which were submitted.

LGST101 presents law as an evolving social institution, with special emphasis on the legal regulation of business. It considers basic concepts of law and legal process, in the U.S. and other legal systems, and introduces the fundamentals of rigorous legal analysis. An in-depth examination of contract law is included. 

Students felt that “this was an interesting class,” perhaps even “one of the most interesting I have ever taken.” This course is “seminar style” with plenty of opportunity for participation. Students “learned a great deal” and found each lecture to be “stimulating.” 

According to his students, Professor Constan is a “really great professor” and “a great person.” The professor “did a good job of facilitating discussion,” as he is “really entertaining.” “His love of students” was evident, especially considering that “he took time to meet with each student individually.” A few students felt that Professor Constan embarrassed students “for getting things wrong.” Some felt that Professor Constan was more challenging than other professors. Students enjoyed “the one-on-one sessions” to meet with the professor. Students liked Professor Constan’s “interesting stories” to help explain the course’s “major ideas.” However another student felt Professor Constan was “long-winded” when explaining certain concepts. 

Some felt that the readings were “dense and confusing,” while others recommended doing the readings to “do well and enjoy lecture.” One student felt that the midterm was “hard” and did not feel that the grading was “objective.” One student would have liked a better syllabus. This review was based on the 3 student comments which were submitted.

LGST101 presents law as an evolving social institution, with special emphasis on the legal regulation of business. It considers basic concepts of law and legal process, in the U.S. and other legal systems, and introduces the fundamentals of rigorous legal analysis. An in-depth examination of contract law is included.

Students found this course to be “extremely interesting.” They believed the course to be relevant “to things you will use every day,” and is worth taking to get “at least a basic understanding of the law.” Students believed this was a “really great class.” “The lectures are very interesting” and “all of the material was relevant.” Students felt that they “learned a lot.”

Students felt that Professor Miller “is a wonderful professor and makes legal studies a joy.” Students felt that his examples and “personal stories” gave “a deeper and more personal perspective on legal issues.” Professor Miller was at times not “very accessible,” but most believed him to be “an excellent instructor” who is “extremely entertaining and knowledgeable.” Professor Miller is “one of the nicest, most approachable professors I have ever met.” The professor is unique in his “ability to stimulate interest.” Professor Miller is very “approachable,” and “one of the best Penn has to offer.”

Some students felt the tests and quizzes were “tricky” or “demanding.” Students struggled to understand how exams were graded, but students “can drop one midterm.”

Some students felt the tests and quizzes were “tricky” or “demanding.” Students struggled to understand how exams were graded, but students “can drop one midterm.”
